D should be the correct answer but it is called Customer ID. Thought could be Agent ID, but that is related to active tokens in installers.

comments.content: Customer ID is the one you used when installing the sensor, Agent ID is the one automatically generated by the system as identifier of the sensor installed in the host so B is Correct

questions.question_text: What is the name for the unique host identifier in Falcon assigned to each sensor during sensor installation?
Which of the following is a valid step when troubleshooting sensor installation failure?

choices.A: Confirm all required services are running on the system
choices.C: Disable SSL and TLS on the host
choices.D: Delete any available application crash log files

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A . Found in TS doc

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: A
All the other choices are wrong. A is the only one makes sense.

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct, tested in UI

Selected Answer: C

questions.question_text: You need to export a list of all detections for a specific Host Name in the last 24 hours. What is the best way to do this?

choices.D: Utilize the Detection Activity Dashboard. Use the filters to focus on the appropriate hostname and time, then export the results from the "Detections by Host" section
choices.A: Go to Host Management in the Host page. Select the host and use the Export Detections button
choices.B: Utilize the Detection Resolution Dashboard. Use the filters to focus on the appropriate hostname and time, then export the results from the "Detection Resolution History" section
choices.C: In the Investigate module, access the Detection Activity page. Use the filters to focus on the appropriate hostname and time, then export the results
